metadata.dc:description: Cryptococcal infection is not frequent in immunocompetent patients. The most commonly involved sites are the lungs and the central nervous system. Cryptococcal osteomyelitis occurs in 5-10% of patients with disseminated cryptococcosis with few reports of cryptococcal arthritis in elderly adults. We describe the case of a 92-year-old woman with a Cryptococcus neoformans knee joint infection associated to osteomyelitis.
metadata.dc:title: Artritis por Cryptococcus neoformans en un adulto mayor: Presentaci칩n de un caso y revisi칩n.
[Cryptococcus neoformans arthritis in elderly adult: case report and review].
